2007_526.pdf:
Draft order laying down the technical standards for organic marine aquaculture production. 

6. Products Concerned
The present draft order is intended to lay down standards relating to the production of marine animals at all their stages of growth, reared in brackish or salt waters, in
any kind of enclosure (pools, ponds, containers, nets and tanks, made of earth, concrete, plastic or metal), including marshes. 

7. Notification Under Another Act
Regulation No 315/93 on contaminants in food. 

8. Main Content
8.1 The draft order is intended to lay down the technical standards governing organic marine aquaculture production, as a system of production, which involves
numerous forms of production in fresh, brackish and salt waters, and involves the farming of many different species. 
It is intended to lay down and stipulate the specific standards characterising organic production in marine aquaculture, as a system of production, which may make
significant contributions to achieving environmental and social objectives. 
Organic production is considered to be one of the production systems which, when applied to marine aquaculture practices, not only contributes to preventing the
pollution of marine waters, but also maintains the biodiversity of species used and produces environmental benefits. 

8.2 The mutual recognition clause appears in Article 3 of the draft order.

Draft Decree adopting the Regulation on gaming machines, amusement arcades and gaming clubs in the Autonomous Community of Castilla y León 

6. Products Concerned
Machines for gambling and games of chance and systems for the interconnection of these machines. 

7. Notification Under Another Act
- 

8. Main Content
1. The aim of the text subject to the report is to regulate all aspects relating to the machines for gambling and games of chance sub-sector, to lay down the requirements which must be met by these machines, and to lay down the operating and installation
system therefor specifying the establishments in which they may be installed. It also contains supplementary operating standards in addition to the operating system for amusement arcades and gaming clubs in which these are to be installed, and, finally,
lays down a penalty system in relation to compliance with that laid down therein. 

2. Member State
Mutual recognition clause: Article 20(2) and 27(4), first final provision, section 3. 

9. Brief Statement of Grounds
The drawing up of the draft is governed by the legal mandate laid down in Article 9 of Law No 4 of 24 June 1998, regulating gaming and betting in the Autonomous Community of Castilla y León, which entrusts the regulation of gaming and betting included
in the catalogue, including that which is played using gaming and betting machines, to the Government of the Autonomous Community of Castilla y León.

6. Products Concerned
AMUSEMENT AND GAMING MACHINES 

7. Notification Under Another Act
- 

8. Main Content
MACHINES. AMUSEMENT. GAMING. GAMES. PRIZES. CASINOS. BINGO HALLS. CLUBS. CREATION OF TYPE A AMUSEMENT MACHINES
WHICH AWARD PRIZES IN KIND IN THE FORM OF CHILDREN’S PRIZES.- AMENDMENT OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF TYPE B AND C
MACHINES.- INTRODUCTION OF TYPE B SPECIAL GAMING CLUB AND BINGO HALL MACHINES.- EXPANSION OF THE MEANS OF PAYMENT
FOR A GAME AND OF PRIZES AS REGARDS MACHINES INSTALLED IN GAMING CLUBS, BINGO HALLS AND GAMING CASINOS.- THE
POSSIBILITY TO INTERCONNECT TYPE C MACHINES INSTALLED IN THE MAIN GAMING ROOM AND IN ATTACHED ROOMS IN ONE AND THE
SAME GAMING CASINO.- DEVELOPMENT OF THE LEGAL CONCEPT OF THE MANUFACTURERS AND IMPORTERS OF GAMING EQUIPMENT.-
THE POSSIBILITY TO TEMPORARILY SUSPEND THE OPERATION AUTHORISATION FOR TYPE B AND C MACHINES AND AMENDMENT OF THE
PERIOD OF VALIDITY OF THE INSTALLATION AUTHORISATIONS.- REMOVAL OF THE REQUIREMENT OF EXCLUSIVE ACTIVITY FOR
APPROVAL TO INSTALL TYPE A AND TYPE B MACHINES IN SPECIFIED LEISURE AND CAFÉ, HOTEL AND RESTAURANT ESTABLISHMENTS.

9. Brief Statement of Grounds
ADAPTATION OF THE CURRENT REGULATION ON AMUSEMENT AND GAMING MACHINES TO THE MOST RECENT AMENDMENTS MADE TO
LAW NO 4 OF 2 JUNE 1998 ON GAMING IN THE AUTONOMOUS COMMUNITY OF VALENCIA. IN ADDITION, THE ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL
REALITY AND ONGOING TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATIONS MAKE IT NECESSARY TO AMEND CERTAIN ASPECTS OF THE REGULATION OF
AMUSEMENT AND GAMING MACHINES IN ORDER TO ADAPT THEM TO SOCIAL AND BUSINESS CHANGES ARISING AS A RESULT OF THE
NEW CURRENT REALITY.

- LAW NO 4 OF 3 JUNE 1998, OF THE GENERALITAT, ON GAMING IN THE AUTONOMOUS COMMUNITY OF VALENCIA (DIARI OFICIAL DE LA
COMUNITAT VALENCIANA NO 842 OF 09/06/1988)

6. Products Concerned
This proposal concerns instruments or systems for measuring the travelling speed of motor vehicles, hereinafter referred to as “speed cameras”,
placed in fixed locations and on static or moving vehicles or aircraft, as well as their peripheral devices used to print out or record the results of the
measurements taken by said instruments. 

7. Notification Under Another Act
- 

8. Main Content
The technical regulation notified sets out the specific regulations, in relation to State metrological control as provided for in Article 7 of Metrology Law
3/1985 of 18 March, for instruments used to measure the speed of motor vehicles, thereby guaranteeing its use in application of applicable road
safety and traffic legislation. 

The draft covers implementation of the following metrological controls on the systems in question: 
- checking compliance with essential technical and metrological requirements for
placement on the market and service (model approval, initial check), 
- verification following repair or modification and periodic checks on devices in use. 

9. Brief Statement of Grounds
It is being implemented to guarantee speed checks on motor vehicles, guaranteeing the
result of the measurement for the individuals sanctioned. 

10. Reference Documents - Basic Texts
References to basic texts: Metrology Law 3/1985 
Royal Decree 889/2006 of 21 July on State metrological control of measurement
instruments 
Order ITC/3699/2006 of 22 November concerning State metrological control of the
condition of instruments used to measures travelling speeds of motor vehicles 
The basic texts were submitted as part of a previous notification: 2005/730/E:
2006/374/E

Order regulating the State metrological control of instruments for the measurement of audible sound and acoustic calibrators, in their conformity
assessment, verification after repair or modification and periodic verification phases. 

6. Products Concerned
The proposal affects audible sound meters, known as sound level meters, personal sound exposure meters, known as exposure meters, and the
acoustic calibrators used therewith. 

7. Notification Under Another Act
- 

8. Main Content
The notified technical regulation lays down specific regulations from the point of view of State metrological control as laid down in Article 7 of
Metrology Act No 3 of 18 March 1985 for the aforementioned instruments. 

The draft provides for the application of the following metrological controls to the aforementioned measuring instruments: 
assessment of conformity to the essential metrological and technical requirements for their marketing and commissioning (previously known
separately as model approval and initial inspection) 
Periodic verification 
Verification after repair or modification 

Key words in the draft: 
sound level meters. 
sound exposure meters, known as exposure meters 
acoustic calibrators 
- audible sound 

9. Brief Statement of Grounds
Its implementation is justified from the point of view of guaranteeing metrological
control for the marketing and commissioning, and throughout their service life, of the
above-mentioned instruments with a view to ensuring compliance with legislation in the
environmental and work health fields. 

10. Reference Documents - Basic Texts
Metrology Act No 3 of 18 March 1985 and Royal Decree No 889 of 21 July 2006 regulating
State metrological control of measuring instruments are attached.

Regulation on Amusement and Gaming machines 

6. Products Concerned
Amusement and gaming machines 

7. Notification Under Another Act
- 

8. Main Content
Aim: The Regulation of gaming by means of amusement and gaming machines. 

Scope of the regulation. AUTONOMOUS COMMUNITY OF VALENCIA 
Exclusions of the regulation. 

Definition, characteristics and classifications of the machines: 
Type A, Type B, and Type C. 

Registration of models. 

Manufacturing, import and marketing system 
Operating system: Identification of the machine 
Operating Companies: Definition, registration and requirements 
Operation and installation of machines 
Authorised premises for operating and installing machines 

Documentation for machines and method of use 

Penalty system: Competence, procedure and faculties of the administration. 

9. Brief Statement of Grounds
The constant changes taking place in the sub-sector of amusement and gaming machines, due to both technological innovations and changing business realities, together with achieving greater legal certainty, recommend the adoption of new legislation.
